snippet: Wall Street’s decline came after a disheartening jobs report in the United States and a report that showed Europe’s economies contracted at an accelerated pace last month.
abstract: Stocks suffer their biggest weekly decline in 2012 following a disappointing US jobs report and the accelerated contraction of several euro zone economies. Chart (M)

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUSER; Catherine Rampell and David Jolly contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: Stocks sank on Friday, with the broader market posting its biggest weekly decline this year after a disappointing report on jobs in the United States. The jobs report, a closely scrutinized monthly gauge from the Labor Department on how the economy is faring, carried the mood over from Asia and Europe, where shares were down after a survey showed that euro zone economies contracted at an accelerating rate last month.

headline.main: A Down Week, Worsened by a Weak Jobs Report
